column4: Hi folks. I just tried installing Ubuntu 7.04 alternate and after install I it hangs, monitors going into sleep and keyboard leds start blinking. Same thing happened right away when I select install from the normal ubuntu 7.04 setup.
Right after the boot menu.
I'd start by booting in from the CD and getting into a rescue environment so you can access the boot logs
the boot file and messages file is a good starting place
is the box really old?
No, not really. AMD64, 3000+.
heh, well at least we can rule out legacy hardware incompatibility
no luck accessing the logs?
easiest way to access the logs would be to use the "Rescue a broken system" option from the alt CD
you're at the recovery terminal prompt right now right?
ok :0
try booting the ubuntu liveCD :D
should be good enough for access to here for now
ahh yes, Linux/Unix 101, everything is case sensetive :)
Ctrl+X will ask you to save
change into the log directory "cd /var/log"
less messages
see if you can spot anything suspicious in there
ls what DO you see in the log dir?
sorry, was tabbed out reading something
the codenames for the versions of Ubuntu
